creator: sergio_rossi

title: Restoring t'bird
content:
Hi,

I've been using Thunderbird for many years, working through a proxy in the US. Unfortunately, the proxy failed without warning. I can still access my inbox and sent files but, of course, I am no longer receiving or sending messages. I have temporarily established an Outlook account, to make sure that anything I do to Thunderbird doesn't mess everything up, but I would much prefer to continue with Thunderbird. To my non-tech mind, my Thunderbird files are floating around without an account with a local provider. Can you please suggest a way that I can link in the existing Thunderbird to an account that I can establish locally?

Thank you in advance, Best regards,

Brian Ellis
creator: b_ellis02

title: Transferred emails to a sub folder aren't visible, but a search finds them
content:
Hi

I've just realised that emails I drag and drop to a subfolder don't appear in that subfolder. However, if I do a Search for an email I know I've sent to that subfolder, I find it, listed in the correct sub folder. It's there, just not showing in Folder view. It appears to have been happening for about 3 weeks.

The problem appears to be with a particular subsubsubfolder (if that makes sense), but other subsubsubfolders under that subsubfolder are fine and accept transfers.

Of course, Sods Law means that this is probably my most important subfolder, and I don't know what I'm missing, short of going back to Webmail to find anything that might be relevant.

I've checked Trash and Archives in case it's somehow connected, but nothing. Can you help please.

Thanks Graham
creator: gburnfie

title: Index compromesso
content: In seguito ad un riavvio improvviso del pc, avviato Thunderbird risulta sparita la posta in arrivo scaricata dal 2018 al 2022. L'oggetto dei messaggi di posta elettronica risulta visualizzabile solo se effettuata una ricerca tramite la barra "Cerca", ma facendo doppio click sul messaggio di posta lo stesso risulta non consultabile. L'account è configurato in POP, quindi il contenuto era presente tutto all'interno del percorso Roaming/.....

title: Mail recovery - profile folders moved from old to new computer
content: Hello, after moving the thunderbird mail folder with my profile and after creating a new account, I am trying to load the migrated mail. The computer for a long time "had" the task and nothing happens. I'm sure I missed something, but I have no idea how to fix this situation. That's a lot of email, but I don't think that's the problem. Please help. I emphasize that I am a layman, so I will be grateful for factual and simple answers. And yes, I know it's very funny and the solution is probably simple. So thank you in advance for comments highlighting my ignorance. I humbly accept even these remarks. Have a nice day
creator: pcengine.pl

title: How To Know Which Address Book A Contact Is In
content:
I have about 20 address books in Thunderbird because I find it easy to group contacts into an address book and then use the "Is In Address Book" option to apply to emails and move them to folders.

There was a change to address books in Thunderbird a year or so ago and now I can't see which address book a contact is in without browsing each one.

I can find the contact by looking at "All Address Books" but that doesn't show me which address book(s) it's in, which would be really handy.

Am I missing something or is there an option/extension that would display it?

Hope I explained this clearly.
creator: TonyPayneUK

creator: jpweber

title: Downloaded messages disappear
content:
Starting the morning of 2/8 somewhere around 6 or 7 am ET, after an automatic update to 102.7.2 (32-bit), all messages that are downloaded from the Yahoo server immediately disappear. Normally, a message at the bottom of the screen shows me download progress, shows where message filters are being applied, shows that x number of messages are moved to Junk, etc. None of this happens. However, the messages are no longer on the server, so I'm no longer able to access them.

Messages received between 2/3 and 2/8 seem to have been moved from the folders they had been filtered to, back to the Inbox. Which now perpetually has 90 messages in it, no matter how many times it retrieves new messages off the server - those new ones disappear, and these old ones remain in the Inbox.

In order to be able to access my older emails in their folders and newer ones using the Yahoo website, I've turned off automatic download on startup. But I really would like to go back to using Thunderbird.

Any help?
creator: aeliusdionysius

title: After Feb. 2023 update Yahoo Mail isn't working
content:
Thunderbird 102, Linux Mint 19.3, POP

Title says it all. I haven't received Yahoo Mail since the update. I've tried the manual download button in the menu bar, and that doesn't work. Automatic downloading isn't working either.

This has happened before after an update, but service was restored by the Thunderbird crew after a couple of days.
creator: vineyridge1

title: thunderbird shows "authenticating required" when I click on a link
content:
Hello

After upgrading to ubuntu 22 I observe a rather strange thunderbird behavior: when I click on a link in an email, the program asks for my local unix password (see screenshot). When I decline it three times, it still though opens the browser and the link no problem. Also, after the password was entered first time, there are no authentication prompts anymore.

This is a strange feature, a bit annoying not because the password itself but because it is a strange action where I would rather not enter any, for security reasons - god knows what else thunderbird wants to do with it?

Also I couldn't find nothing related in the settings to turn that feature off.

Please help!

Message: "Authentication required. The login keyring did not get unlocked when you logged into your computer"
creator: dmitry8

title: Cannot attach. Says no permission.
content:
Suddenly, when I attach a file to an outgoing message, I'm told that I need permissions that I don't have. The properties of the file show that anybody can do anything to it. It's as if Thunderbird is running under some id other than mine.

I've restarted and rebooted, but no change. I've tried other files in other folders, but it's the same. What can I do? This is a SERIOUS problem for me.

THANKS
creator: neil91

title: Address Book
content:
A few days ago, I exported a profile backup to a USB drive from an up-to-date version of Thunderbird - Using Windows 10. I then replaced the motherboard, processor and memory. Fitted a new ssd drive and reconnected the old ssd drive.

After performing a clean install of Windows 11 and a fresh up-to-date Thunderbird install, on what is effectively a new computer, I logged into my email accounts. Everything worked well, except:

I have lost my contacts - the address book is empty. All attempts to import the back-up files failed. All attempts to replace the a.book.sqlite and history.sqlite files using Windows file explorer (while Thunderbird was closed) failed.

Can you help?

Thanks in advance, Dave.
creator: DaveN190

title: Thunderbird Spellcheck not working
content:
I'm using Thunderbird 102.7.2 on Windows 10 Pro X64.

Recently (past week or so) spellcheck is not working. I have checked numerous posts but nothing has helped to resolve the issue.

-I checked Tools-Settings-Composition and and "Enable spellcheck as you type" is enabled -Under Tools-Settings-General-Languages "English(CA)" is the default dictionary, "English(US)" is the alternative Neither of these have been changed. -After pressing "F7" or "Ctrl-Shift-P", the "Check Spelling" window opens but it does nothing. -There are no extensions installed.

What else can I check?
creator: gkcoulter

title: After many years, I have suddenly been unable to download new emails from my earthlink account.
content:
After many years of use, I am suddenly unable to download emails from my Earthlink account. In fact, it seems as though there is no contact between Thunderbird and Earthlink. However, I am able to send emails via that account using Thunderbird.

I am also able to access emails on Earthlink's online site, just not able to download them to Thunderbird.

I have 6 other email accounts in Thunderbird that have no problems, but Earthlink is my primary domain.

I am using Thunderbird 102.7.2 with Windows 11. I use Windows Defender as Antivirus and Firewall.

I've tried deleting the global-messages-db file and the ,msf file but neither changed things. I deleted my saved password in the "settings" file, but when I tried to download emails, was not prompted for a new password.

I'll be really grateful for any help with this problem. Thanks to you all in advance.
creator: stephenday1951

title: Receiving Emails from certain email address
content:
Hello, With my email, I am not getting any from my dad (just started 5 days ago)... he uses a Bigpond email address. I have received emails from him in the past but now none of them are getting through. On his end it looks as they that have been sent and gone through, I just never get them. I have no filters on my email so not in junk etc... and not in the online site either.

Also - at the same time, I am getting emails out of order... If one email sent to a group, I am often getting a group members reply before I get the original email....

I am worried I am not getting other important emails
